net.cloud.client.nio.packet

Interface Packet

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ButtonActionPacket, CompositePacket, LoginPacket, LoginPacket.LoginDataRequestPacket, LoginPacket.LoginDataResponsePacket, LoginPacket.LoginResponsePacket, LogoutPacket, ReceiveOnlyPacket, SendOnlyPacket, ShowMessageDialogPacket, TestPacket

    public interface Packet
    Interface defining a packet. This is the data type for objects sent between the client and server for communication purposes. Each packet has on opcode defining which packet it is, like a GUID. Each packet also knows how to encode, decode, and handle itself.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Packet decode(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf data)
      Decodes the Packet.
      void encode(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
      Packs the information contained in the Packet into a ByteBuf.
      short getOpcode() 
      void handlePacket(Player player)
      Executes whatever action the Packet needs to take, to take action on the information stored in it.

    • Method Detail

      • getOpcode

        short getOpcode()
        Returns:
        The opcode associated with this Packet

      • encode

        void encode(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
     throws BufferableException
        Packs the information contained in the Packet into a ByteBuf. The Packet at this point should already be initialized.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The ByteBuf that data will be placed into, from the current position
        Throws:
        BufferableException - If there is an issue encoding a Bufferable object

      • decode

        Packet decode(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf data)
       throws BufferableException
        Decodes the Packet. Takes the data and creates a copy of the specific Packet implementing class. The Packet returned is a copy with the members set according to the data, not the original.
        Parameters:
        data - The data required for the Packet, assumed to be without header.
        Returns:
        A copy of the Packet deserialized to reflect the provided data
        Throws:
        BufferableException - If there is an issue decoding a Bufferable object

      • handlePacket

        void handlePacket(Player player)
        Executes whatever action the Packet needs to take, to take action on the information stored in it. Split from the decoding process, but assumes the Packet has been created and initialized.
        Parameters:
        player - The player receiving the packet
